actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to remove the earnings limitation and to permit benefit payments to a widower, parent, or child despite his or her marriage if such marriage is annulled.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to remove the limitation on the amount of outside income which an individual may earn while receiving benefits under such title. Allows benefit payments to a widower, parent, or child despite that person's marriage if the marriage is annulled.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to remove the earnings limitation and to permit benefit payments to a widower, parent, or child despite his or her marriage if such marriage is annulled.
